variant.question: During which of the following phases of flight is a fixed pitch propeller’s angle of attack highest?

options.text: Take-off run.
Low-speed glide.
High-speed glide.
Climb.

variant.question: During which of the following phases of flight is a fixed pitch propeller’s angle of attack lowest?

options.text: High-speed glide.
Climb.
Take-off run.
Low-speed glide.

variant.question: Fixed-pitch propellers are usually designed for maximum efficiency at:

options.text: cruising speed
take-off
full throttle
idling

variant.question: For an aeroplane equipped with a two-position variable pitch propeller it is advisable to select a

options.text: fine pitch for take-off and climb.
fine pitch for cruise and coarse pitch for landing.
coarse pitch for take-off and climb.
fine pitch for cruise.

variant.question: Constant-speed propellers deliver better performance than fixed-pitch propellers because they:

options.text: operate at a relatively high propeller efficiency over a wider speed range than a fixed pitch propeller.
have a higher maximum propeller efficiency than a fixed-pitch propeller.
have more blade surface area than a fixed-pitch propeller.
produce a relatively higher thrust than a fixed-pitch propeller.

variant.question: For any propeller:

options.text: thrust is the component of the total aerodynamic force on the propeller parallel to the rotational axis.
thrust is the component of the total aerodynamic force on the propeller in the plane of rotation.
the total aerodynamic force on a blade element may be resolved into two components, torque and lift.
the force contributing to propeller torque is perpendicular to the propeller plane of rotation.

variant.question:
Which statement are correct or incorrect when comparing a fixed pitch propeller with a constant speed propeller?
1) A constant speed propeller improves propeller efficiency over a range of cruise speeds.
2) A coarse fixed pitch propeller is more efficient during take off.

options.text: 1) is correct, 2) is incorrect
1) is incorrect, 2) is correct.
1) is incorrect, 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct, 2) is correct.

variant.question: If the RPM lever of a constant speed propeller is moved forward during a glide with idle power and whilst maintaining constant airspeed, the propeller pitch will:

options.text: decrease and the rate of descent will increase.
increase and the rate of descent will decrease.
increase and the rate of descent will increase.
decrease and the rate of descent will decrease.

variant.question: For a fixed-pitch propeller, the blade angle of attack:

options.text: decreases during the take-off.
can never become negative.
is always positive during idling descent.
decreases when the aeroplane speed decreases (with constant engine RPM).

variant.question: For a fixed-pitch propeller, the blade angle of attack:

options.text: can become negative during high-speed idle descent.
is lower in ground run than in flight (with constant engine RPM).
is always positive during idling descent.
decreases when the aeroplane speed decreases (with constant engine RPM).

variant.question:
Which statement is correct when comparing a fixed pitch propeller with a constant speed propeller? 


1) A constant speed propeller reduces fuel consumption over a range of cruise speeds
 
2) A constant speed propeller improves take-off performance as compared with a coarse fixed pitch propeller.

options.text: 1) is correct, 2) is correct.
1) is correct, 2) is incorrect.
1) is incorrect, 2) is incorrect.
1) is incorrect, 2) is correct.

variant.question: With a fixed pitch propeller increasing speed will ___ propeller angle of attack. Increasing power and therefore propeller RPM will ___ propeller angle of attack.

options.text: decrease; increase
increase; increase
increase; decrease
decrease; decrease

variant.question: Assuming that the RPM remains constant throughout, the angle of attack of a fixed pitch propeller will:

options.text: decrease with increasing airspeed.
remain constant at a fixed value only if the airspeed decreases.
increase with increasing airspeed.
remain constant at a fixed value irrespective of any airspeed changes.

variant.question: Assuming that the RPM remains constant throughout, the angle of attack of a fixed pitch propeller will:

options.text: increase with decreasing airspeed.
remain constant at a fixed value irrespective of any airspeed changes.
decrease with decreasing airspeed.
remain constant at a fixed value only if the airspeed decreases.

variant.question: The angle of attack of a fixed pitch propeller blade increases when:

options.text: forward velocity decreases and RPM increases.
forward velocity increases and RPM decreases.
forward velocity and RPM increase.
forward velocity and RPM decrease.

variant.question: The angle of attack of a fixed pitch propeller blade increases when:

options.text: forward velocity decreases and RPM increases.
forward velocity increases and RPM decreases.
velocity and RPM increase.
velocity and RPM decrease.

variant.question: The angle of attack of a fixed pitch propeller blade decreases when:

options.text: forward velocity increases and RPM decreases.
forward velocity and RPM increase.
forward velocity and RPM decrease.
forward velocity decreases and RPM increases.

variant.question: When the blades of a propeller are in the feathered position:

options.text: the drag of the propeller is then minimal.
the propeller produces an optimal windmilling RPM.
the windmilling RPM is the maximum.
the RPM is then just sufficient to lubricate the engine.

variant.question:
Which statement is correct when comparing a fixed pitch propeller with a constant speed propeller? 

I A constant speed propeller reduces fuel consumption over a range of cruise speeds
 II A coarse fixed pitch propeller is more efficient during take-off.

options.text: I is correct, II is incorrect
I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is correct, II is correct.

variant.question: You are the pilot flying an aircraft equipped with a constant speed propeller. While maintaining straight and level flight, the propeller angle of attack decreases. In these conditions, the propeller governor (1) _____ the pitch and the RPM eventually (2) _____.

options.text: (1) increases; (2) remains the same
(1) increases; (2) increases
(1) decreases; (2) increases
(1) decreases; (2) remains the same

variant.question: For a fixed-pitch propeller in flight at a given TAS, the blade angle of attack will

options.text: decrease if RPM decreases.
increase if RPM decreases.
remain constant if RPM increases.
remain constant if RPM decreases.

variant.question: A windmilling propeller

options.text: degrades the glide performance of an aeroplane.
produces more thrust than drag.
has a greater blade angle than a feathered propeller.
produces neither thrust nor drag.

variant.question: What happens to the blade pitch of a constant speed propeller on ground roll during takeoff?

options.text: Increases.
Same effect as the fixed pitch propeller.
Decreases.
Remains constant.

variant.question: Which statement is correct when the chord length of a propellers blades is increased?

options.text: Power absorption increases and propeller efficiency decreases
Power absorption decreases and propeller efficiency decreases
Power absorption Increases and propeller efficiency increases
Power absorption increases and propeller efficiency stays the same

variant.question: A fixed pitch propeller is usually:

options.text: at too coarse an angle for take-off.
at its optimum angle on take-off.
at too fine an angle for take-off.
at too coarse an angle in the cruise.
